conclusion: Problem involves shadows moving when a light source moves backward.
Four objects each casting a shadow labeled A, B, C, and D.
Object A is circular, casting a shadow that's also circular.
Object B is triangular, casting a shadow that's triangular.
Object C is cylindrical, casting a shadow that's rectangular.
Object D is another triangular shape, casting a shadow that's triangular.
Assumption based on common shadow behaviors due to lack of visibility of actual objects.
Shadows will change in both position and size when the light source moves backward.
Shadow A will elongate and become an ellipse, moving farther from the object and increasing in size.
Shadow B will elongate and become a larger triangle, possibly with distorted angles.
Shadow C will elongate and become longer, moving away from the object and increasing in size.
Shadow D will elongate and become larger, possibly with distorted angles.
Summary: All shadows A, B, C, and D will move away from the objects and become larger.
